intro: Lactuca saligna var. runcinata, commonly known as the curly leaf lettuce, is a cultivated variety of lettuce characterized by its distinctive, ruffled leaf edges. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has a rosette structure with broad, lobed leaves. Its leaves are often used in salads and can be harvested before the plant flowers. This variety is valued for its mild flavor and crisp texture, making it a popular choice in culinary applications.
